edu.illinois.mitra.starl.functions

Class SingleHopMutualExclusion

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.illinois.mitra.starl.functions.SingleHopMutualExclusion
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cancellable, MessageListener, MutualExclusion

    public class SingleHopMutualExclusion
extends java.lang.Object
implements MutualExclusion, MessageListener
    A mutual exclusion implementation in which permission tokens are exchanged in a single message "hop". To ensure that no entity is locked out, token requesters are enqueued by the token holder and requestor queues are passed along with the tokens. The number of mutex sections and the agent initially holding all tokens must be known at the time of construction.

      • SingleHopMutualExclusion

        public SingleHopMutualExclusion(int num_sections,
                                GlobalVarHolder gvh,
                                java.lang.String leader)
        Create a new SingleHopMutualExclusion
        Parameters:
        num_sections - the number of mutex tokens to track
        gvh - the main GVH
        leader - the identifier of an agent who initially holds all tokens. All entities must use the same value in order for mutex to function properly
